dc:title: Fall Appeal - October/November 1966
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: She asks for help--"It is hard to be a beggar." Admires the voluntary poverty of St. Francis, Gandhi, and Peter Maurin. In contrast, the "destitute and dissolute" are often despised as "bums" in the city and we fail to see "the sacred element in every human being." (Simone Weil)
